cars.descCar: Built for a life centered around sport.The 718 models transfer the racing spirit of the legendary Porsche mid-engined race cars from the 1950s and 1960s – such as the 718 RSK Spyder or the 718 GTR Coupe – to the roads of today with one goal: To elevate the everyday beyond the ordinary.

engine.title: Turbo engine
engine.desc: The four-cylinder boxer engines of the 718, 718 Style Edition and 718 S models are designed to be powerful and efficient. The Turbo technology with a compact exhaust turbocharger that is optimally adapted to the displacement and power of the engine is responsible for this.

engine.title: Naturally aspirated engine
engine.desc: In the 718 GTS 4.0 models, the 4.0-liter 6-cylinder naturally aspirated engine with 294 kW (394 hp) at 7,000 rpm delivers powerful propulsion and an enormous performance spectrum. Responsiveness? Direct. High revs? Oh yes. Highly emotive and efficient.

powerTras.title: Porsche Doppelkupplung (PDK)
powerTras.desc: The 7-speed PDK with manual and automatic modes allows for extremely fast gear changes without interruption in traction. In manual mode, the direction of shifting is the same as in race cars – upshift to the rear, downshift to the front.

powerTras.title: Six-speed manual transmission
powerTras.desc: Alternatively, power is transmitted through a smooth, 6-speed manual transmission, perfectly tuned to the engine's characteristics. The gear changes are sporty and short – the shift effort is low. For a sporty, direct driving experience.

chassis.title: Greater comfort. Improved performance.
chassis.desc: Optional Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM) continuously adjusts the damping force for each individual wheel – according to driving style and road conditions. In addition, the body is lowered by 10 mm.

chassis.title: PASM sport suspension.
chassis.desc: The 718 GTS 4.0 models are equipped with the PASM sport chassis. The body is lowered by 20 mm. The springs and anti-roll bars are tuned for more direct and agile handling with high cornering performance.

cars.descCar: Unfiltered driving pleasure. Open top.Pure GT engineering in a proudly open-top 2-seater. Puristic, unfiltered, genuine. The 718 Spyder RS is a mid-engine roadster that leaves worries behind in fractions of a second. For driving pleasure with a powerful sound that you can hear and feel immediately.

engine.title: High-revving naturally aspirated engine.
engine.desc: The GT4 RS engine in a roadster: 493 hp at 8,400 rpm, max. torque 331 lb-ft at 6,750 rpm. The 4.0-liter, 6-cylinder boxer, high-revving, natural aspirating engine with a maximum of 9,000 rpm is by far the most powerful in the 718 model range.

engine.title: Engine technology derived from motorsports.
engine.desc: 6 individual throttle valves supply the 6 cylinders with air optimally for direct responsiveness and excellent dosing of the engine. It is powerful and robust thanks to a central oil feed, forged pistons and lightweight titanium con rods.

engine.title: Transmission
engine.desc: The shifts of the performance-oriented 7-speed Porsche Doppelkupplung (PDK) are fast and emotive. Even the 7th gear has a short, sporty response. The mechanical locking differential ensures optimal power transmission.

engine.title: Porsche Torque Vectoring (PTV).
engine.desc: The PTV improves the driving dynamics. The integrated mechanical rear differential lock enables higher traction and significantly improved lateral dynamics and driving stability during load changes in corners and when changing lanes.

powerTras.title: Chassis with GT technology.
powerTras.desc: Precise handling for winding mountain passes: lightweight suspension strut axles, taut springs and helper springs, in combination with specific wheel mounts, helps to ensure high traction and stability. Ball joints allow particularly precise wheel guidance.

powerTras.title: Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM, –30 mm).
powerTras.desc: The electronic adjustment of the damping control system actively and continuously adjusts the damping force on each wheel, based on current road conditions and driving style. The PASM has two settings: sporty-comfortable and sporty-firm.

chassis.title: Front axle lift system.
chassis.desc: One inch may not sound like much, but it makes a decisive difference at speeds of up to around 37 mph thanks to the increased ground clearance.

chassis.title: Deceleration in RS style.
chassis.desc: The 718 Spyder RS slows down impressively quickly thanks to the 6 and 4-piston aluminum monobloc fixed caliper brakes (front/rear) with Red brake calipers, large cast iron composite brake discs and efficient brake ventilation and cooling.

cars.descCar: Perfectly irrational.A razor-sharp track machine. A highly agile mid-engine concept. A six-cylinder naturally aspirated engine with a displacement of 4.0 liters and 493 hp. A high-revving concept that easily hits the 9,000 mark.

engine.title: 4.0 liter six-cylinder naturally aspirated boxer engine.
engine.desc: Derived from the 911 GT3 R and 911 RSR directly: {368 kW (493 hp) at 8,400 rpm, max. torque 331 lb-ft at 6,750 rpm. The centrally positioned 4.0-liter six-cylinder high-revving naturally aspirated boxer engine is by far the most powerful in the 718 model range.

engine.title: Engine technology derived from motorsports.
engine.desc: 6 individual throttle valves supply the 6 cylinders with air for direct responsiveness and excellent dosing of the engine. It is powerful and robust thanks to a central oil feed, forged pistons and lightweight titanium con rods.

engine.title: From irrational to perfect in a hundredth of a second.
engine.desc: The shifts of the performance-orientated 7-speed Porsche Doppelkupplung (PDK) are fast and emotive. Even the 7th gear has a short, sporty response. The mechanical locking differential ensures optimal power transmission.

engine.title: Porsche Torque Vectoring (PTV).
engine.desc: The PTV improves the driving dynamics. The integrated mechanical rear differential lock enables higher traction and significantly improved lateral dynamics and driving stability during load changes in corners and when changing lanes.

powerTras.title: Chassis with GT technology.
powerTras.desc: Lightweight suspension strut axles, taut springs and helper springs in combination with specific wheel mounts ensure high traction and stability. Ball joints allow particularly precise wheel guidance.

powerTras.title: Personalized setup.
powerTras.desc: The ride height, camber, toe and anti-roll bar can be adjusted for use on the race track. The result is a race track chassis for high cornering dynamics, spontaneous steering behaviour and higher cornering speeds.

powerTras.title: Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM, –30 mm).
powerTras.desc: The electronic adjustment of the damping control system actively and continuously adjusts the damping force on each wheel, based on current road conditions and driving style. The PASM has two settings: sporty-comfortable and sporty-firm.

chassis.title: Porsche Stability Management (PSM).
chassis.desc: PSM is an automatic control system for maintaining stability at the limits of dynamic driving performance. The systems can be switched off completely in two stages.

chassis.title: Lift system on the front axle.
chassis.desc: 30mm may not sound like much, but it makes the difference at speeds of up to around 37 mph with the increased ground clearance.

chassis.title: Deceleration in RS style.
chassis.desc: For fast and safe braking to a standstill: Six-piston front and four-piston rear aluminum monobloc fixed calipers in red and large cast-iron brake discs. The efficient brake ventilation and cooling system is specially designed for high loads.

cars.descCar: The one and always.Anyone who dreams of a Porsche usually has one image in their mind: the 911 has been the epitome of an exciting, powerful sports car with day-to-day usability for 60 years. Take a seat behind the wheel of the new 911 and become part of a unique community.

engine.title: 3.0-liter flat-6 engine.
engine.desc: The powerful 3.0-liter 6-cylinder flat engine with twin turbochargers will give you goosebumps with its incomparable sound alone. The horizontally opposed construction and the traditional position in the rear end of the vehicle also allows for a low center of gravity.

engine.title: Performance.
engine.desc: Peak performance: 290 kW (388 hp). Top track speed: 183 mph. Maximum torque: 331 lb-ft and a sprint from 0 to 60 mph in 3.9 s, it's highly unlikely that you will ever want to get out again.

powerTras.title: PDK.
powerTras.desc: The 8-speed Porsche Doppelkupplung (PDK) allows extremely fast gear changes without interrupting the flow of power. The PDK combines sporty tuning in 1st to 6th gear with efficient overdrive ratios (7th and 8th gear).

cars.descCar: The one and always.The 911 Carrera T: For over 55 years, the T has stood not only for touring, but above all for puristic driving pleasure — thanks to targeted lightweight construction, emotional engine sound, characteristic design elements and a precise manual transmission.

engine.title: Rear-axle steering.
engine.desc: At low speeds, the standard rear-axle steering simplifies maneuvering or turning and increases agility in tight corners. At higher speeds, it significantly increases driving stability.

powerTras.title: PTV
powerTras.desc: PTV enhances vehicle dynamics and stability by applying brake pressure to the rear wheels, in conjunction with a rear differential lock. For increased stability, outstanding traction and high agility.

engine.title: Structure
engine.desc: Crucial to the high performance of the T-Hybrid system: the innovative main components. From the completely redeveloped 3.6-liter flat 6 engine with electric exhaust turbocharger to the electric motor integrated in the PDK and the light, powerful traction battery.

engine.title: 3.6-liter flat 6 engine.
engine.desc: This is what only a 911 sounds like: the new flat engine in the rear is impressive with its classic 6 cylinder symphony, an increase in displacement from 3.0 to 3.6 l and further increased power output.

engine.title: Electric motor in the PDK.
engine.desc: The electric motor integrated in the Porsche Doppelkupplung (PDK) offers high torque even at low speeds – and delivers its power directly. In Recuperation mode, it sends energy back to the battery.

powerTras.title: Electric exhaust turbocharger.
powerTras.desc: The electric exhaust turbocharger ensures a faster increase in the performance-determining boost pressure and thus accelerated response behavior. In Recuperation mode, energy from the exhaust stream is converted into electrical energy – similar to the Porsche 919 Hybrid developed for racing.

powerTras.title: High-voltage battery.
powerTras.desc: The light and compact 400-volt traction battery has been optimized for maximum performance. It stores the energy gained through recuperation for new, unforgettable acceleration processes.

chassis.desc: System power: 398 kW (532 hp). Top track speed: 194 mph. Maximum torque combined: 449 lb-ft and a sprint from 0 to 60 mph in 3.0 s, it's highly unlikely that you will ever want to get out again.

cars.descCar: The 911 Turbo.Our engineers like to talk about the most perfect sports car ever. Extremely sporty, at the same time comfortable and fully suitable for everyday use. The 911 Turbo models consistently follow this path.

engine.title: Exhaust turbocharger
engine.desc: Larger exhaust turbochargers and piezo injectors are used for the first time. Exhaust manifolds derived from the 911 GT2 RS improve responsiveness and efficiency.

engine.title: Charge air cooling and engine air.
engine.desc: Charge air cooling¹ and engine air intake² have been completely redesigned. The result: enhanced performance.

powerTras.title: 8-speed PDK.
powerTras.desc: The completely re-developed 8-speed Porsche Doppelkupplung (PDK) allows extremely fast gear changes without an interruption in traction – in a matter of milliseconds.

powerTras.title: PTM all-wheel drive.
powerTras.desc: Porsche Traction Management (PTM) has been continuously developed. It is now more robust and offers improved control. The result: increased precision and resilience.

chassis.title: PASM
chassis.desc: Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM) actively and continuously controls the damping force for each individual wheel. For the first time, a PASM sport chassis (-10 mm) is offered as an option on the 911 Turbo models.

chassis.title: PTV Plus
chassis.desc: Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus (PTV Plus) enhances driving dynamics and stability by applying targeted brake pressure to the rear wheels, in conjunction with a rear differential lock.

chassis.title: Rear-axle steering.
chassis.desc: At low speeds, the rear-axle steering simplifies maneuvering or turning and increases agility in tight corners. At higher speeds, it significantly increases driving stability.

body.title: Maximum permissible roof load with Porsche roof transport system

service.value: 4 years/50,000 miles (whichever comes first) including 24-hour roadside assistance program

cars.descCar: The one and always.For almost 25 years the 911 GT3 has accepted only the limits of physics — and left the ordinary far behind. Motorsport-tested design and maximum performance ensure it unwaveringly bridges the boundary between the racetrack and the road.

engine.title: 4.0 liter high-revving natural aspirating engine.
engine.desc: 502 hp, 331 lb-ft torque, 193 mph top speed: The 4.0-liter 6-cylinder naturally aspirated flat engine turns numbers into pure goosebumps — especially when accelerating from 0 to 60 mph in 3.2 s¹.

engine.title: 7-speed PDK and manual transmission.
engine.desc: The 7-speed Porsche Doppelkupplung (PDK) with sporty tuning and the 6-speed GT Sport manual transmission¹, which is 37 lbs lighter, delight with short gear ratios offering high agility. The gearshift feel: precise and direct.

chassis.title: Aero bars
chassis.desc: The aero bars on the front axle were previously reserved for the 911 GT3 RS. They now increase the downforce of the 911 GT3 by reducing turbulence and improving the flow rate behind the bars.

chassis.title: Brakes.
chassis.desc: The standard braking system is already impressive with its high suitability for racetracks and very good pressure point behavior. The Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB)¹ decelerates with even higher braking performance, consistent brake pressure and excellent fading stability.

chassis.title: Aerodynamic highlights.
chassis.desc: Look forward to headwinds: The rear wing with swan neck connection, the front lip with new contour and the adapted underbody fins improve airflow and increase downforce.

service.value: 4 years/50,000 miles (whichever comes first) including 24-hour roadside assistance program

cars.descCar: Sportmade.Every athlete knows the absolute willingness to question everything is crucial to achieving top performance. With this attitude, Porsche continues to push back the boundaries of what is possible.

engine.title: High-revving naturally aspirated engine.
engine.desc: The 4.0 l six-cylinder flat engine uses 4-valve technology including valve lever and rigid valve drive as well as forged pistons and titanium con rods. Also from the world of motorsport: The dry sump lubrication with separate engine oil tank.

engine.title: More robust.
engine.desc: The sports 7-speed Porsche Doppelkupplung (PDK) is especially robust on the race track, thanks to a modified bleeding system with an adjusted ratio.

engine.title: PTV Plus
engine.desc: Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus (PTV Plus) works with an electronically-controlled, fully-variable rear differential lock. For increased traction and improved lateral dynamics as well as enhanced driving stability under load change conditions.

powerTras.title: Chassis control systems.
powerTras.desc: The electronic adjustment of the shock absorber system – Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM) – regulates the damper force for each wheel. Porsche Stability Management (PSM) helps to ensure stabilization at the limits of the driving dynamics.

powerTras.title: Chassis bearings.
powerTras.desc: For maximum performance. More precise handling. And a firm connection between the chassis and body. All chassis bearings are equipped with ball joints, further increasing dynamics.

powerTras.title: Rear-axle steering.
powerTras.desc: By steering the rear wheels, the system increases agility when cornering at low speeds. It provides greater driving stability at high speeds or when overtaking on the track.

chassis.title: Brakes
chassis.desc: Providing high dimensional stability and very good response: 6-piston aluminum front brake calipers and 4-piston aluminum rear brake calipers in monobloc. The optional Porsche Ceramic Composite Brake (PCCB) is even more committed to lightweight construction and motorsport.

chassis.title: Hydraulic lift system.
chassis.desc: The optional front-axle hydraulic lift system raises the front of the 911 GT3 RS by 1.6 in. This reduces the risk of grounding on curbs, ramps and parking lot entrances when driving.

chassis.title: 800-V technology.

chassis.title: Air suspension.
chassis.desc: The adaptive air suspension with PASM reacts extremely quickly to dynamic changes while driving — depending on preferences and the selected driving mode with a focus on sportiness or comfort. For driving over uneven surfaces, the Smart Lift function raises the vehicle at the push of a button and saves the location so that it can react automatically in the future.

chassis.title: Rear-axle steering.
chassis.desc: The optional rear-axle steering, which is standard on the Taycan Turbo S, ensures more dynamic steering behavior while cornering and makes maneuvering and parking in tight spaces much easier.

A wide range of exterior and interior colors from the Taycan range is available in addition to Black.

engine.title: 'Black Edition' lettering.
engine.desc: The Black Edition side lettering in Black on the front doors adds a special accentuating detail.

engine.title: Door sill guards.
engine.desc: Making the Black Edition unmistakable even in the dark: Front door sill guards with Black Edition lettering illuminated in White. The brushed aluminum guards bear the model logo for the rear door sill guards.

engine.title: Driver's key with key pouch.
engine.desc: Completing the Black Edition: Set of two driver's keys painted in High Gloss Black with Black Edition lettering and exclusive key pouch.

cars.descCar: Courage is a decision.Exciting visions are always worth fighting for. As is a genuine four-seater sports car that combines impressive performance with a high level of comfort. Many said it was impossible. Others called it brave.

engine.title: The 2.9-liter twin-turbo V6 engine in the Panamera.
engine.desc: The Panamera is powered by a 2.9-liter twin-turbo V6 engine with power output of 260 kW (348 hp) and torque of 368 lb-ft.

engine.title: 8-speed PDK.
engine.desc: Unusual in a luxury sedan, standard in a sports car: the 8-speed Porsche Doppelkupplung (PDK) with automatic mode and manual operation via paddles on the steering wheel. The precise gear changes take place in milliseconds without any noticeable interruption in traction.

chassis.title: All-wheel drive.
chassis.desc: With the exception of the rear-drive Panamera, all models are equipped with Porsche Traction Management (PTM): active all-wheel drive system with an electronically variable, map-controlled multi-plate clutch, automatic brake differential (ABD) and anti-slip regulation (ASR).

chassis.title: Rear-axle steering.
chassis.desc: Optional rear-axle steering (standard on the Panamera Turbo S E-Hybrid) enhances performance and day-to-day usability in equal measure. At low speeds, the turning circle is reduced, agility is increased and parking becomes noticeably easier to manage. At higher speeds, driving stability is increased. The result: greater maneuverability and driving comfort in everyday use.

cars.descCar: More drive. For ambitious destinations.The Panamera 4 E-Hybrid turns travel into a sporting event and business into pure pleasure. With impressive system performance, made possible by the interaction between the combustion engine and the electric motor.

engine.title: The hybrid drivetrain.
engine.desc: The system power is achieved through the combination of the combustion engine and the electric motor. Both drives can be used together as a system or separately, depending on the requirements.

engine.title: Electric motor
engine.desc: The electric motor, with a maximum power of 140 kW (187 hp) and a maximum torque of 331 lb-ft, ensures superior driving performance in the purely electric E-Mode and recuperates energy back into the battery during deceleration.

chassis.title: Driving modes.
chassis.desc: With driving modes specially designed for the hybrid drivetrain, you can switch between purely electric, the most efficient hybrid, or sport focus, depending on your route and personal preferences.

chassis.title: High-voltage battery.
chassis.desc: The lithium-ion battery with 25.9 kWh energy capacity ensures a long electric range and also powers electric auxiliary systems such as the air conditioning compressor and the electric brake booster. It can be charged with up to 11 kW of charging power using the on-board AC charger.

engine.title: Electric motor
engine.desc: The electric motor, with a maximum power of 140 kW (187 hp) and a maximum torque of 331 lb-ft, ensures superior driving performance in the purely electric E-Mode and recuperates energy back into the battery during deceleration.

chassis.title: Driving modes.
chassis.desc: With driving modes specially designed for the hybrid drivetrain, you can switch between purely electric, the most efficient hybrid, or sport focus, depending on your route and personal preferences.

chassis.title: High-voltage battery.
chassis.desc: The lithium-ion battery with 25.9 kWh energy capacity ensures a long electric range and also powers electric auxiliary systems such as the air conditioning compressor and the electric brake booster. It can be charged with up to 11 kW of charging power using the on-board AC charger.

cars.descCar: A solid sports figure.To be successful in sport, you have to stay focused and remember what’s important. It is precisely this that the three letters GTS express to perfection. They make the Panamera GTS a Gran Turismo for sports car purists.

engine.title: 4.0-liter V8 twin-turbo engine.
engine.desc: In addition to its power output of 368 kW (493 hp) and maximum torque of 486 lb-ft, another special feature that underscores the sports car character of the Panamera GTS is the naturally aspirated power delivery of the newly developed 4.0-liter twin-turbo V8 engine.

engine.title: Chassis
engine.desc: The sport suspension, specially tuned for the Panamera GTS, enables particularly high driving dynamics. The adaptive air suspension features fully load-bearing air spring struts in 2-chamber 2-valve technology, lowering of 10 mm and the electronically controlled Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM) damper system. The rear axle sway bar and the tuning of the chassis control systems are also GTS-specific.

chassis.title: PTV Plus
chassis.desc: Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus (PTV Plus) is a variable torque distribution system on the rear wheels including an electronically controlled reardifferential lock. The overall result: high lateral dynamic vehicle stability. Excellent traction. Great agility with precise steering response and balanced load alteration behavior. For even more pleasure on corners.

chassis.title: Sport Chrono Package.
chassis.desc: The package with the eponymous stopwatch on the dashboard offers an even sportier tuning of the engine, gearbox and chassis. The mode switch on the steering wheel can be used to choose between driving modes. The Sport Response button primes the engine and gearbox for the fastest possible unleashing of power – for example, for overtaking. Launch Control helps achieve the best possible acceleration from a standstill.

chassis.title: All-wheel drive.
chassis.desc: With the exception of the rear-drive Panamera, all models are equipped with Porsche Traction Management (PTM): active all-wheel drive system with an electronically variable, map-controlled multi-plate clutch, automatic brake differential (ABD) and anti-slip regulation (ASR).

cars.descCar: Dare forward.Get in. Drive off. Seek adventure. The Macan is and remains the sports car among compact SUVs. At first glance, its Porsche DNA can be recognized by the sloping roof line, known as the flyline.

engine.title: 2.0-liter turbo engine.
engine.desc: The inline four-cylinder turbo engine in the Macan delivers maximum performance and efficiency even with its small size. It is characterized by its high drag torque and efficiency.

powerTras.title: 7-speed PDK.
powerTras.desc: When in automatic mode, the Porsche Doppelkupplung (PDK) changes gear very fast without any interruption in traction. Do you prefer to change gear manually? The gearshift paddles are on the steering wheel.

powerTras.title: PTM all-wheel drive.
powerTras.desc: The Porsche Traction Management (PTM) with electronically controlled multi-plate clutch distributes the drive power variably between the drive axles. For high traction, even in adverse conditions.

powerTras.title: Off-road mode.
powerTras.desc: In off-road mode, all relevant systems switch to a traction-oriented off-road program that improves drivability and comfort during off-road use.

chassis.title: Air suspension.
chassis.desc: The optional air suspension including PASM adapts to different driving situations: High level I, normal level and low level. The loading level lowers the rear axle for convenient loading and unloading.

chassis.title: PASM chassis.
chassis.desc: Depending on the driving style and road conditions, Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM)¹ regulates the damping force for each individual wheel – and, depending on the selected mode, the suspension setting from comfortable to sporty and stiff.

chassis.title: PTV Plus.
chassis.desc: The optional Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus (PTV Plus) increases driving dynamics and stability, especially when cornering, with an electronically controlled, variable rear differential lock.

cars.descCar: Further together.Over 20 years ago we asked ourselves if a sports car could celebrate more than the individual. The Cayenne provided the answer. And it continues to perfect it to this day. For people who want to tread their own path.

engine.title: 4.0-liter twin-turbo V8 engine in the Cayenne S.
engine.desc: The Cayenne S is powered by a 4.0-litre twin-turbo V8 engine with a maximum power output of 468 hp and a drag torque of 442 lb-ft.. V8 engines stand for exceptional power output, high torque, smooth operation and a characteristic sound.

engine.title: Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM).
engine.desc: PASM allows electronic adjustment of the damping control system and is standard on all Cayenne models. It actively and continuously adjusts the damping force according to the road conditions and driving mode. For reduced body shell movement and more comfort in every seat. The settings available are Normal, Sport and Offroad as well as Sport Plus in combination with the Sport Chrono package.

powerTras.title: Adaptive air suspension.
powerTras.desc: The enhanced adaptive air suspension with full load-bearing air-spring struts in 2-chamber technology allows for an even greater combination of comfort and sportiness while at the same time maintaining the same ride comfort. The level system helps to maintain a constant ride height. By adjusting the height of the chassis, the ground clearance can be varied as required, for example during off-road use. The rear end can also be lowered for easier loading of the luggage compartment.

powerTras.title: Chassis
powerTras.desc: Whether you're in the driver's seat or a passenger: Driving a Porsche should feel like a sport while still offering great comfort. The Cayenne models manage this balancing act effortlessly: thanks to the enhanced chassis and technologies that adapt the chassis even better to the intended use — such as off-road use. Examples include the adaptive air suspension, the Porsche Dynamic Chassis Control (PDCC) for active roll stabilization and the rear-axle steering.

powerTras.title: Brakes
powerTras.desc: That's why all Cayenne and Cayenne S models are equipped with a brake system with six-piston aluminum monobloc fixed calipers at the front and four-piston aluminum monobloc fixed calipers at the rear. The one-piece, closed construction results in a very high dimensional stability. The pressure point is precise and the braking distance is impressively short.

engine.title: Driving modes for increased flexibility.
engine.desc: With driving modes specially designed for the hybrid drive, the Cayenne E-Hybrid models develop their potential. Depending on the route and personal preferences, it can be switched between all-electric, the most efficient hybrid, or sport focus.

powerTras.desc: The lithium-ion battery ensures superior driving performance in E-mode. For more flexibility on the road, the battery can be charged in E-Charge mode using the combustion engine or the high-performance AC charging process.

cars.descCar: Further together.The appearance: refined. The start: accelerated. The driving performance: increased. The Cayenne GTS transforms strength into adrenaline — for all five passengers.

engine.title: 4.0-liter V8 twin-turbo engine.
engine.desc: Powerful, efficient and particularly emotional thanks to direct power delivery: The 4.0-liter V8 twin-turbo engine with a maximum of 493 hp and a maximum torque of 486 lb-ft. V8 engines stand for exceptional power output, high torque, smooth operation and a characteristic sound that rounds off the Sport Exhaust system even further.

engine.title: Chassis
engine.desc: The GTS specific tuned chassis enables outstanding driving dynamics. The adaptive air suspension impresses with fully load-bearing air-spring struts in 2-chamber technology and a lowering of the vehicle by 10 mm. The electronically controlled Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM) damper system is equipped with an even sportier setup. The Porsche Dynamic Chassis Control (PDCC) provides active roll stabilization on request.

powerTras.title: PTV Plus
powerTras.desc: Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus (PTV Plus) ensures dynamic cornering and driving stability. It works by precisely applying brake pressure to the inside rear wheel and an electronically regulated rear differential lock. This ensures outstanding vehicle traction when accelerating out of corners.

powerTras.title: Sport Chrono Package.
powerTras.desc: For extra performance: The optionally available Sport Chrono Package provides an even sportier setup of the chassis, engine and transmission. Predefined driving modes can be further individually configured with various vehicle settings. Pressing the Sport Response button prepares the engine and transmission for the fastest possible unleashing of power — resulting in maximum responsiveness for a period of approximately 20 seconds.

powerTras.title: Brakes
powerTras.desc: The brake system is adapted to the exceptional power output of the GTS models. The brakes feature 6-piston aluminum monobloc fixed calipers at the front and 4-piston aluminum monobloc fixed calipers at the rear. The brake disc diameter: 410 mm at front and 365 mm at rear. The Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) with carbon fiber-reinforced ceramic brake discs is available as an option.

cars.descCar: Further together.If we wish to achieve excellence in performance, we need an outstanding foundation to rely on. And the right team. There is room for both in the Cayenne Turbo GT. The hunt for best times can begin. In a group of four.

engine.title: 4.0-liter V8 twin-turbo engine.
engine.desc: Makes starting off an exciting start: the 4.0 liter V8 twin-turbo engine with 650 hp and a max. torque of 626 lb-ft unleashes pure power. Together with the 8-speed Tiptronic S automatic transmission and the specially tuned chassis systems, it enables the Cayenne Turbo GT to excel in longitudinal and lateral acceleration.

engine.title: Chassis
engine.desc: A powerful engine is one thing. But the power output must be transformed into optimal driving dynamics. The specifically tuned chassis helps the Cayenne Turbo GT achieve top values. Examples of this include wider wheels with greater camber on the front axle, adaptive air suspension including Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM), Porsche Dynamic Chassis Control (PDCC), Porsche Torque Vectoring Plus (PTV Plus) and rear-axle steering.

powerTras.title: Titanium sport exhaust system.
powerTras.desc: Expressive and exclusive at the same time: the sport exhaust system in titanium. The central oval tailpipes don't disappoint and provide a powerful V8 soundscape. Thanks to the light metal, they also save on vehicle weight.

powerTras.title: Brakes
powerTras.desc: Proven in motorsports: the Porsche  Ceramic Composite Brake (PCCB). The cross-drilled ceramic brake discs have a diameter of 440 mm at the front 410 mm at the rear. The PCCB has Yellow 10-piston aluminum monobloc fixed calipers on the front axle and 4-piston aluminum monobloc fixed calipers on the rear axle. They provide brake pressure that is considerably more powerful and, crucially, exceptionally consistent during prolonged use.
